page.title: 03St.Mary's Church,Rye
page.content: St. Mary's church is a very old and famous church which dates back 800 years. There are different styles of architecture because some of the church was burnt down in the fire by the French in 1377 and rebuilt soon after. The church has two quarter boys that ring bells on the quarter hour. Also there is a very old clock, probably one of the oldest in England. There are some very beautiful stained glass windows, especially the east and west ones. Many famous people to the town of Rye are buried here, like James Lamb the mayor. The church is one of the oldest buildings in the town. Once England gave Rye to the French, but about a century later England regained it.
